bibl.title: A Clay Sealing from Karanis in the Kelsey Museum.
bibl.note: Kelsey Museum, Inv. 24431 (excavation number 30-C123CCH1-E). Bulla with one complete impression, one partial impression. Clay (3.0 × 2.2 cm). Karanis, second to third centuries CE. - Hundreds of sealings were recovered in 1930 from Granary C123. The featured sealing was part of a group of twenty-three found in one of the sunken bins in a barrel-vaulted room. It bears two oval impressions of a male figure, possibly Sarapis, with a right-profile head and feet, and frontal torso.
bibl.seg: Gates Jennifer E., A Clay Sealing from Karanis in the Kelsey Museum.

Kelsey Museum, Inv. 24431 (excavation number 30-C123CCH1-E). Bulla with one complete impression, one partial impression. Clay (3.0 × 2.2 cm). Karanis, second to third centuries CE. - Hundreds of sealings were recovered in 1930 from Granary C123. The featured sealing was part of a group of twenty-three found in one of the sunken bins in a barrel-vaulted room. It bears two oval impressions of a male figure, possibly Sarapis, with a right-profile head and feet, and frontal torso.
